normalised: E-V Charging Gets a Festive Boost!

unnormalised: Bangalore, Karnataka - Looks like getting your electric ride juiced up is about to get a whole lot easier, just in time for Diwali! Ather Energy just announced a massive expansion of their charging grid, Ather Grid, across major cities.
normalised: Bangalore, Karnataka - Looks like getting your electric ride juiced up is about to get a whole lot easier, just in time for Diwali! Ather Energy just announced a massive expansion of their charging grid, Ather Grid, across major cities.

unnormalised: They're aiming for a charging point every 5 km in bustling areas like Koramangala. This is great news, especially considering all the Diwali shopping trips! No more range anxiety ruining your holiday spirit.
normalised: They're aiming for a charging point every five kilometer in bustling areas like Koramangala. This is great news, especially considering all the Diwali shopping trips! No more range anxiety ruining your holiday spirit.

unnormalised: Tata Power is also stepping up, planning to install more chargers near highway dhabas – perfect for those long drives to visit family in places like Mysore! Imagine stopping for some biryani and simultaneously topping up your EV.
normalised: Tata Power is also stepping up, planning to install more chargers near highway dhabas – perfect for those long drives to visit family in places like Mysore! Imagine stopping for some biryani and simultaneously topping up your E-V.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, IIT Madras is working on developing faster charging tech. They’re aiming to drastically reduce charging times, something that would be a HUGE relief for EV owners. Some experts are even talking about wireless charging becoming a reality sooner than we think. Now that's something to look forward to! Forget the firecrackers; electrifying the future is the real Diwali dhamaka! Maybe next Onam, we’ll see dedicated EV charging stations at every roadside eatery.
normalised: Meanwhile, I I T Madras is working on developing faster charging tech. They’re aiming to drastically reduce charging times, something that would be a huge relief for E-V owners. Some experts are even talking about wireless charging becoming a reality sooner than we think. Now that's something to look forward to!
